page.title: 16BANSTEAD MANOR STUD VISIT
page.content: We went to Banstead Manor Stud Farm in Cheveley, and Mr Morriss, the stud owner showed us round. They breed thoroughbred horses for racing here, and have mares and 2 stallions. It is a public stud because mares are brought in to mate with the stallions. This is different from White Lodge Stud in Cheveley because only mares are kept there and these are taken to public studs. The horses are worth a lot of money and Mr Morriss has made a lot of money. Ten people work on the stud. The farm is 350 acres. The horses eat grass and hay and have vitamins so they can run faster and get strong. The stallions' names are 'Isle de Bourbon' and 'Beldale Flutter'. They are both big and strong and have larger stables than the other horses. Both stallions have won lots of races.
